name: BEST WESTERN Riverside Apartments

reviews.text: As we were visiting Melbourne to go to the football at Telstra Dome, do a bit of shopping and have an evening of entertainment at the Crown Casino we were looking for a two bedroom apartment that was located to all of our planned activities and the Riverside Apartments fitted the bill.
reviews.title: Great Location & Great Views

reviews.text: The apartment we had was on the 17th Floor and provided us with all the room and all the facilities that we needed. The view was fantastic looking out over The Yarra River over to the Southbank development and Crown Casino.
reviews.title: Castle Clan

reviews.text: The only areas that we would criticise would be the bathrooms which are a bit dated and the noisy air-conditioning, but once you realise that you are not paying Hyatt prices you accept it.
reviews.title: Turnaround Apartments
We loved it
reviews.text: Stayed in March 2008 and quite frankly couldn't wait to leave. The apartment was dirty and not what we expected for the money. Very noisy at night, right next to nightclub heaven which was no good when with a family and the windows would not shut to blank out the music.

Reception staff were unhelpful and seemed to know little of the surrounding area when asked, they even tried to charge us for the cost of the accommodation again on departure due to "out of date paper work".
reviews.title: Great Location, walk to Crown, City

reviews.text: This was our second stay at this location and again we wer not disapointed. Tourist tram stops right out the front, short work straight across river to crown and short walk to main shopping district. Apartments clean and spacious with fantatic views of the flame shows at the crown and yarra river. Good kitchen and laundry facilities within room. Staff helpfull and courtious . Highly recomended
reviews.title: Great Location & good value

reviews.text: After reading the mixed reviews on Trip Advisor we were a little apprehensive about this self-servicing apartment. However, given the prices in Melbourne for hotels, the price for a married couple and their two adult children was better than most, so we took a breath and booked an apartment. We are very glad we did. Check in was efficient and well handled, even though we arrived at about 10 AM after a 30 hour travel time from the US. The location is great, literally around the corner from the free City Circle Line Tram stop. The apartment was larger than expected very clean and well appointed. We had two bedrooms, two bathrooms, washer/dryer, fully equiped kitchen, dining area and living area with floor-to-ceiling windows that had a wonderful view of the city and the river bank, and a balcony (albeit small). Everything was very clean. Towels were replaced, the apartment was tidied, garbage emptied every day. The front desk was very polite and helpful, and even helped to arrange transportation back to the airport for 4 AM. There are a couple of bars across the lane but they presented no problem, either noise wise (perhaps being on the 15th floor helped?) or any other way. Restaurant prices were expensive by US Standards, so we were very happy to be directed to a Coles Supermarket that was within easy walking distance. The only "quibbles" were the charge for internet (paid per 24 hours) and the $25/day fee for parking the rental car. Otherwise, we had no complaints about this establishment, and if in Melboiurne again would definitely stay here if it were available.
reviews.title: Great self-service apartment in Melbourne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This accommodation ranks with the worst I have ever experienced. The name of the accommodation is Riverview, there is no river view, there are no windows in the bedroom, it was like living in a bunker. Very claustrophobic. We were expecting a 5 night celebratory Easter Break for my birthday. The only window that opened did so for only 6 inches. It overlooked Highlander Lane which was the place of choice, it seems, for the patrons of the surrounding clubs to use as an accessory toilet. There was a lot of noisy vomiting and a lot of shouting and fighting throughout the early hours, we were constantly woken. The mornings would find young street people rummaging through the plant holders for remnants of alcohol in discarded cans and bottles. Although its location is handy to a lot of city highlights, iI did not feel safe to walk out at night unaccompanied. We were confronted more than once by groups of loud and excited men outside the nearby strip clubs. There is plenty of other accommodation in Melbourne in the same price bracket and with good location and access to highlights as this one. I regret not being able to check out accommodation before booking. This one simply does not deliver. The only recommendation I could make about this hotel, is stay away.
reviews.title: Holiday from Hell

reviews.text: we stayed at the Riverside during the Melbourne Cup for 7 nights in a two bedroom apartment. We had read some of the reviews and didnt know what to expect, however we were pleasantly surprised. The apartment was exceptionally clean and comfortable. the furniture and fittings were quite modern and pleasant. The kitchen was fully equipped and contained a full sized refridgerator. Best of all the location is superb, it is within walking distance to almost everything Melbourne CBD has to offer as well as a 5 minute walk to Crown Casino. The tram stop is a 20 metre walk from the entrance of the hotel. Reception was helpful and professional and looked after us very well. The rooms were well sound proofed and overall we had an exceptional stay. I would definately stay here again when in Melbourne. Well done Riverside, you are a true gem in the heart of Melbourne.,
reviews.title: great apartment hotel in excellent location
Average
reviews.text: Stayed in the Highlander annex for 3 nights and did not have high expectations after reading previous reviews.

Our friends were over from the UK and asked us to find an apartment in the Melbourne CBD where they could stay for 3 nights, We booked them onto Riverside Apartments as it sounded like the 2 bedroom apartment (we found them through the riverside website) would be ideal for a family of 4.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the 2nd night of their stay our friends invited us to see the flames at the casino from the apartment. The view was great and the rooms were huge. We collected our friends on check-out and they thanked the receptionist for a great stay. The lovely girl on reception mentioned they had new management and were undergoing renovations and apologised for the workmen passing through but this did not upset us. Highly Recommended.
reviews.title: Rooms Ok, Location Extremely Noisy

reviews.text: This is one of the biggest apartments that I have stayed in while in Melbourne. The location is great however the units are above a strip of nightclubs and discos that pump out booming music until 3.30am. It is impossible to get to sleep. Given this we won't be booking again. The free carparking was great and the service excellent. The noise was the only thing going against the place.
reviews.title: Please, please do not waste your money staying here

likes.disliked: — Filthy, badly maintained apartment and rude staff who should not be in the service industry

reviews.text: We checked out of the Riverside Apartments this morning after only one night (we had booked five!) and felt compelled to write an instant review as this was the WORST place I have ever stayed, in terms of living up to it's description. I have travelled the world both for business and pleasure and have NEVER felt compelled to check out of a hotel early because I research where I am going to stay extremely well. The reviews of this serviced apartment hotel looked fairly good when we booked it - affordable, mid range, centre of the city, etc. We weren't looking for luxury boutique, but rather something that was comfortable, well maintained, clean and with helpful staff. None of these aspirations could be applied to the Riverside Apartments. In addition, it is located on the doorstep of the city's sex industry. As we walked through this area (which we took a large detour to try and avoid on the way home) the boucers / doorman on all the strip joints were saying "good evening" to our 16 year old daughter. OK, this is not the hotels fault, but when we mentioned our unease at this on our return to the hotel when asked by the man on reception how our night had been, we were sneered at by him and told that all doormen at strip joints did this. Hey, we're broad minded people, live in Camden Town in London and see all sorts every day - what I don't expect is to be told by a hotel receptionist that something I wasn't expecting in what we thought was a good hotel in a good area is OK!! The final straw was being woken up at 8am by DRILLING in the building! However, on the plus side, the lounge area of the apartment was enormous, and the view over the River Yarra was spectacular, if you like skyscraper / city views. Let me take the negatives in order:
reviews.title: Spacious apartment, friendly and helpful staff, great views of Yarra!
The right option if you travel with a family
reviews.text: Comfortable: Sitting on the sofa's was like sitting on a cushion cover that someone had forgotten to put a cushion in.

reviews.title: We will return.
reviews.text: Our first visit to Melbourne was Agent arranged and on arrival we were delighted with our Apartment. In the CBD, just a stones throw away from the Aquarium,the Yarra River and the Crown Casino et al. All the comforts of home with the attractions of the centre city within easy walking distance. The assistance and advice that we received from the Reception staff over the 12 days of our holiday could not be faulted. We are planning a return trip in 2004 and hope to stay again at the Riverside. A return booking is probably the best recommendation that we could give.

description: Year remodeled - 2008/9. Best Western Riverside Serviced Apartments are located in the CBD of Melbourne and offer two types of accommodations. Riverside annex apartments described as the annex rooms when booking are located on the corner of Flinders and Highlander Lane situated on the first, second and third floors, just near our reception in Highlander Lane. All apartments in this building are one bedroom. Both riverside and the annex rooms are conveniently located at the historic and entertainment end of the city, just minutes walk to crown casino, Melbourne exhibition and convention centers, aquarium, Southbank restaurants, observation deck and Etihad Stadium.
